Hi all!

I have the same problem with the size of some of the logs created =
by
WCT (Web Curator Tool). I can't upgrade the WCT versi=F3n neither
embebe=
d heritrix versi=F3n ( 1.8 ).

Some days ago i tried to harvest a web page =
which produced lots of uri
errors (many of them were socket timeout excepti=
ons, so nothing
relevant) and some local errors too. The fact is that when =
this web 
reached at the point of having 113Gb downloaded, the size os the =
.log
files directory was nearly 1Tb !

So, my question is; is there any any=
way to decrease the info storaged
in this log files or they may be that way=
 by fact?

I noticed that modifying the file heritrix.properties into
aheri=
trix-1.8.0.jar and refining the trace level with OFF; could by
one of he wa=
ys:



--- aheritrix-1 .8.0. heritrix.properties-jar-----------------------=
-----

Currently # necessary (?) For standard logs to work
crawl.level =3D =
OFF
Runtime-errors.level =3D OFF
Local-errors.level =3D OFF
Uri-errors.leve=
l =3D OFF
Progress-statistics.level =3D OFF
recover.level =3D OFF
---------=
---------------------------------------------------------------------------=


But i didn=B4t noticed any change in other harvestings, so i don=B4t thin=
k
that=B4s the way.

Any ideas around this?


Thanks again for your help.

=
Un saludo,
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...=

eritrix.properties which has

gging in your uri-error.log?
